How to Install r-cran-etm on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • r-cran-etm

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install r-cran-etm on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing r-cran-etm on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall r-cran-etm in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install r-cran-etm, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install r-cran-etm Using apt

To install r-cran-etm in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install r-cran-etm using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install r-cran-etm

The installation of r-cran-etm might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install r-cran-etm Using apt-get

To install r-cran-etm using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install r-cran-etm.

sudo apt-get -y install r-cran-etm

Install r-cran-etm Using Synaptic

To install r-cran-etm using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install r-cran-etm on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for r-cran-etm. This will display the r-cran-etm package in the package window, now to install r-cran-etm, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the r-cran-etm package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of r-cran-etm.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install r-cran-etm Using aptitude

To install r-cran-etm on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of r-cran-etm.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install r-cran-etm using the command aptitude install r-cran-etm.

sudo aptitude -y install r-cran-etm

How to Upgrade r-cran-etm on debian

If you want to upgrade the r-cran-etm package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade r-cran-etm using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade r-cran-etm to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade r-cran-etm.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade r-cran-etm sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade r-cran-etm

Upgrade r-cran-etm using Aptitude

To upgrade r-cran-etm using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade r-cran-etm.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade r-cran-etm

Upgrade r-cran-etm using Synaptic

To upgrade r-cran-etm using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for r-cran-etm, now right-click r-cran-etm, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade r-cran-etm just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall r-cran-etm on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall r-cran-etm from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just r-cran-etm, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove r-cran-etm

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of r-cran-etm

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of r-cran-etm you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge r-cran-etm

Remove r-cran-etm using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall r-cran-etm using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for r-cran-etm, right-click the r-cran-etm package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall r-cran-etm click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install r-cran-etm on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade r-cran-etm using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of r-cran-etm then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
